WorkItem.Description:
Adding computed, read-only properties to the destination mapping type and not explicitly .ForMember(m => m.ReadOnlyProperty, p=> p.Ignore()) -ing them throws a superfluous AutoMapperConfigurationException saying that these properties are not mapped.  Seeing as how it is impossible to map to read-only properties, AutoMapper should check this first before throwing this exception.
Â 
Also, an AssertConfigurationIsValid that only validates Profile configurations would be immensely useful.  When testing and refactoring my own code, I don't want to be responsible for validating other team members' potentially invalid AutoMapper Profiles.
WorkItem.Summary: AssertConfigurationIsValid fails to auto-ignore read-only properties

Comments.Message:
This one's fixed in R120 - both the configuration validation and the ability to validate individual profiles.



** Closed by jbogard 8/15/2009 5:12 PM

I updated to the latest SVN HEAD as of 8/27/2009 10:00AM CST. Read-only properties on the target class are still causing validation errors when calling AssertConfigurationIsValid on the profile. Read-only properties cannot be mapped to and should be ignored in the validation.

Oh actually nevermind. I was checking the LINQ-to-SQL generated foreign key relationship properties that shouldn't be mapped to, not the read-only properties I have. My mistake! The issue is closed. Thanks for the per-profile validation btw! Works great :)
